meanings.definition: To make or become smaller in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: She is lessening the load by removing some books from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The rain is lessening as the storm moves away.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand, lessening the number of rabbits in the hat.
meanings.sent4: With each passing day, the grip of winter was lessening its hold on the land.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a sponge to demonstrate the concept of lessening the amount of water in the cup.

meanings.definition: A reduction in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The lessening of the crowd allowed us to move more freely.
meanings.sent2: There was a noticeable lessening of tension in the room after the apology.
meanings.sent3: The lessening of sugar in the recipe made the cake taste strange.
meanings.sent4: The lessening of sunlight marked the beginning of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that the lessening of pain was a positive sign of healing.
